intro: Senecio chihuahuensis, commonly known as Chihuahua groundsel, is a flowering plant native to the Chihuahuan Desert in North America. It is a low-growing perennial shrub that typically reaches a height of about 10 to 30 centimeters. The plant features narrow, linear leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers in clusters during the summer months. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. Senecio chihuahuensis is part of the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is known for its ecological importance to desert wildlife.
